O that thou <FI>wert<Fi> as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! <FI>when<Fi> I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.<RF>I should not…: Heb. they should not despise me<Rf>
I would lead thee, <FI>and<Fi> bring thee into my mother's house, <FI>who<Fi> would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
His left hand <FI>should be<Fi> under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.
I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake <FI>my<Fi> love, until he please.<RF>that…: Heb. why should ye stir up, or, why, etc<Rf><CM>

Who <FI>is<Fi> this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth <FI>that<Fi> bare thee.

Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love <FI>is<Fi> strong as death; jealousy <FI>is<Fi> cruel as the grave: the coals thereof <FI>are<Fi> coals of fire, <FI>which hath a<Fi> most vehement flame.<RF>cruel: Heb. hard<Rf>
Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if <FI>a<Fi> man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.<CM>
We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?
If she <FI>be<Fi> a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she <FI>be<Fi> a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
I <FI>am<Fi> a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.<RF>favour: Heb. peace<Rf>
Solomon had a vineyard at Baalhamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand <FI>pieces<Fi> of silver.
My vineyard, which <FI>is<Fi> mine, <FI>is<Fi> before me: thou, O Solomon, <FI>must have<Fi> a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.<CM>
Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear <FI>it<Fi>.
Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.<RF>Make…: Heb. Flee away<Rf><CM>
